section.p:
Notifications are the communication tool for alarms. They follow the structure derived from:
ABC 3413 SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB
ABC 3014 NOTIFICATION-LOG-MIB
ABC 3413 SNMP-TARGET-MIB
ABC 3877 Alarm MIB

Managers can review alarm models in the Alarm MIB to determine if a notification is of interest for alarm management. If no entries in the alarmModelTable can match a particular notification, then that notification is not relevant to the alarm models defined.

Information in the alarm model such as the Notification ID or the description specify which error or warning condition the alarm indicates. If the ITU-ALARM-MIB is also supported, additional information is provided via the probable cause.
